alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 10:12PM CST until March 06 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion affecting Obion, Gibson and Dyer Counties. For the Obion River...including Martin, Obion, Bogota...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Farmland near the river is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 34.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CST Sunday was 34.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.1 feet on 02/08/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 900 AM CST.
